definition: 1. The act of driving back, or the state of being driven back; reflection; reverberation; as, the repercussion of sound. Ever echoing back in endless repercussion. Hare. 2. (Mus.)  Rapid reiteration of the same sound. 3. (Med.)  The subsidence of a tumor or eruption by the action of a repellent. Dunglison. 4. (Obstetrics)  In a vaginal examination, the act of imparting through the uterine wall with the finger a shock to the fetus, so that it bounds upward, and falls back again against the examining finger.
